roleset.name: pay in advance
roleset.note: PREPAY-V NOTES: Frames file for 'prepay' based on sentences in wsj. No Verbnet entry. (from prepay.01-v predicate notes)
PREPAYMENT-N NOTES: Based on ontonotes nouns. Comparison to pay.01 and payment.01. Pay.01 is a member of VN class pay-68 and FN class ommerce_pay. Framed by Katie. (from prepayment.01-n)

example.name: single arg
example.text: Since [most mortgages]-1 can be prepaid or refinanced *trace*-1 at any time, issuers of mortgage securities retain the right to buy back their bonds before maturity.

example.name: with price and seller
example.text: Weirton, of Weirton, W. Va., said [$60.3 million of the proceeds]-1 were used *trace*-1 *trace*-1 to prepay the remaining amounts on the note outstanding to National Intergroup Inc., the parent of National Steel.
example.arg: the remaining amounts on the note outstanding
to National Intergroup Inc., the parent of National Steel

example.name: with agent and price
example.text: MEDUSA Corp. said it voluntarily prepaid $7 million on its original $75 million term loan, bringing the total debt reduction for the year to $18 million.
example.arg: on its original $75 million term loan
bringing the total debt reduction for the year to $18 million

example.name: be careful: this is not arg 1
example.text: There could be fairly heavy prepayments on the premium securities

example.name: This is arg1
example.text: a prepayment of 160% of the PSA model
